content.question:
<math alttext="N i, solid, produces, N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, one electron, produce, A g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Which of the following is the balanced net ionic equation for an oxidation-reduction reaction between <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> and <math alttext="N i, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the half-reactions represented above?

choices.label: <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, N i, solid, react to produce, A g, solid, plus, N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Ni</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, N i, solid, react to produce, A g, solid, plus, 2 N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Ni</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, 2 N i, solid, react to produce, A g, solid, plus, 2 N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ni</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, N i, solid, react to produce, 2 A g, solid, plus, N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Ni</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, N i, solid, react to produce, 2 A g, solid, plus, N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Ni</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
